description: Present Perfect Continuous tense is used to describe an action that started in the past and continues into the present, or has just finished.
examples: I have been studying English for three years.
She has been working here since 2020.
They have been waiting for the bus.
question: Complete: I _____ been _____ for two hours.

description: Future Perfect tense is used to describe an action that will be completed before a specific point in the future.
examples: By next year, I will have graduated from university.
She will have finished the project by Friday.
They will have arrived by the time we get there.
question: Complete: By tomorrow, she _____ _____ the report.

description: Past Perfect tense is used to describe an action that was completed before another past action or time.
examples: I had already eaten when she arrived.
They had left before the storm started.
She had studied English before moving to London.
question: Complete: He _____ _____ the book before the movie came out.

formula: Subject + be + going to + base verb
description: Future with 'going to' is used to express intentions, plans, or predictions based on present evidence.
examples: I am going to study harder next semester.
It's going to rain later today.
They are going to visit Paris next summer.
question: Complete: We _____ _____ _____ travel to Japan next year.

description: Modal verb 'should' is used to give advice, make recommendations, or express obligation.
examples: You should exercise regularly for better health.
She should arrive early for the meeting.
They should study more to improve their grades.
question: Complete: Students _____ _____ their homework on time.

description: Modal verb 'would' is used to express conditional statements, polite requests, or habitual past actions.
examples: I would help you if I had more time.
Would you please close the window?
When I was young, I would play outside every day.
question: Complete: If I _____ rich, I _____ travel the world.

description: Modal verb 'could' is used to express possibility, ability in the past, or polite requests.
examples: You could try calling her tomorrow.
When I was younger, I could run very fast.
Could you please pass me the salt?
question: Complete: I _____ _____ swim when I was five years old.

description: Modal verb 'must' is used to express necessity, obligation, or strong probability.
examples: You must finish your homework before watching TV.
She must be tired after such a long day.
Students must arrive on time for the exam.
question: Complete: You _____ _____ your seatbelt while driving.

description: 'Be used to' expresses familiarity or habit with something. It means something is normal or familiar.
examples: I am used to waking up early.
She is used to the cold weather.
They are used to working long hours.
question: Complete: He _____ _____ _____ living in the city now.

description: 'Used to' expresses a past habit or state that no longer exists.
examples: I used to play piano when I was younger.
She used to live in Paris.
They used to go to the beach every summer.
question: Complete: We _____ _____ go camping every summer.
